intro: Hieracium fussianum, commonly known as the Füssen hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, hairy, and lance-shaped, while its stems are upright and often branched. Hieracium fussianum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in its native habitat.
